</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The accompanying Notes to
	Consolidated Financial Statements are an integral part of these statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-6
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D337825DS1A_HTM_FIN337825_6">
</A>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note 1&#151;Nature of Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Trade Desk,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) was
	formed in November 2009 as a Delaware corporation. The Company is headquartered in Ventura, California and has offices in various cities in the United States, Europe, Asia and Australia. The Company is a technology company that empowers advertising
	agencies and other buyers by providing a self-service platform that enables clients to purchase and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across various advertising formats.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Initial Public Offering
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In September 2016, the Company completed an initial public
	offering (&#147;IPO&#148;). See Note 9&#151;Capitalization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Risks
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company is subject to certain business risks, including dependence on key employees, competition, market acceptance of the Company&#146;s platform, ability to source demand from buyers of advertising
	inventory and dependence on growth to achieve its business plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Basis of Presentation and Principles of Consolidation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements are
	prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&#147;GAAP&#148;) and include the operations of the Company and its wholly owned subsidiaries. All intercompany transactions have been eliminated
	in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Reverse Stock Split
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On September&nbsp;2, 2016, the Company
	effected a 1-for-3 reverse stock split of its outstanding common stock and a proportional adjustment to the then existing conversion ratios for each series of convertible preferred stock. Accordingly, all share and per share amounts for all periods
	presented in these consolidated financial statements and notes thereto, have been adjusted retrospectively, where applicable, to reflect this reverse stock split and adjustment of the preferred stock conversion ratios.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Use of Estimates
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The preparation of consolidated financial statements in
	conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the
	reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ materially from these estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-going
</FONT>
	basis, management evaluates its estimates, primarily those related to:
	(1)&nbsp;revenue recognition criteria, including the determination of revenue reporting as net versus gross in the Company&#146;s revenue arrangements, (2)&nbsp;allowances for doubtful accounts, (3)&nbsp;the useful lives of property and equipment
	and capitalized software development costs, (4)&nbsp;income taxes, (5)&nbsp;the valuation of common and preferred stock for periods prior to the completion of the IPO, (6)&nbsp;assumptions used in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Black-Scholes
</FONT>
	option pricing model to determine the fair value of stock-based compensation and (7)&nbsp;the recognition and disclosure of contingent liabilities. These estimates are based on historical data
	and experience, as well as, various other factors that management believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying value of assets and liabilities that are not readily
	apparent from other sources. Estimates relating to the valuation of common and preferred stock required the selection of appropriate valuation methodologies and models, and significant judgment in evaluating ranges of assumptions and financial
	inputs. Actual results may differ materially from those estimates under different assumptions or circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-7
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Revenue Recognition
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company generates revenue from clients who enter into
	agreements to use the Company&#146;s platform to purchase advertising inventory, data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features. The Company charges clients a platform fee, which is a percentage of a client&#146;s purchases
	through the platform. In addition, the Company invoices clients for the cost of advertising inventory purchased, plus data and any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features purchased through the platform less any advertising inventory
	that clients purchase directly from suppliers through the Company&#146;s platform. The Company maintains agreements with each client and supplier in the form of master service agreements, which set out the terms of the relationship and access to the
	Company&#146;s platform.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company recognizes
	revenue when four basic criteria are met: (1)&nbsp;persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists; (2)&nbsp;delivery has occurred or services have been rendered; (3)&nbsp;the fees are fixed or determinable, and (4)&nbsp;collectability is reasonably
	assured. In applying the foregoing criteria, the Company recognizes revenue upon the completion of a transaction, that is, when a bid is won, subject to satisfying these criteria. Subsequent to a bid being won through the Company&#146;s platform,
	the associated fees are generally not subject to adjustment or refund. Historically, any refunds and adjustments have not been material. The Company assesses collectability based on a number of factors, including the creditworthiness of a client or
	advertiser and related payment history. The Company generally bills clients for the gross amount of advertising inventory, data or other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features they purchase through the Company&#146;s platform plus
	the Company&#146;s platform fees, although some of the Company&#146;s clients have payment relationships directly with advertising inventory suppliers in which case the Company only bills the clients for data, other services and the Company&#146;s
	platform fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company reports revenue net
	of amounts it pays suppliers for the cost of advertising inventory, data and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features in conformity with Accounting Standards Codification
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;ASC&#148;)&nbsp;605-45,
</FONT>
<I>
	Revenue
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Recognition-Principal
</FONT>
	Agent Considerations
</I>
	. The determination of whether the Company is the principal or agent, and hence
	whether to report revenue on a gross basis for the amount of the advertising inventory,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	third-party
</FONT>
	data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features the clients purchase using the
	platform plus the Company&#146;s platform fees or on a net basis for the amount of platform fees charged to the client, requires the Company to evaluate a number of indicators, none of which is presumptive or determinative. The Company determined
	that it is not the primary obligor for the purchase of advertising inventory,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	third-party
</FONT>
	data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features but rather the primary obligor to provide a
	platform that enables clients to bid on advertising inventory, and use data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features in designing and executing their campaigns. The Company does not have pricing latitude with respect to the
	cost of advertising inventory,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	third-party
</FONT>
	data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features purchased by clients through the Company&#146;s platform. The fee the Company charges clients
	is a percentage of their purchases through the Company&#146;s platform, similar to a commission, and the Company&#146;s fee is not contingent on the results of an advertising campaign. The client has supplier selection for the advertising inventory,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	third-party
</FONT>
	data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features through the platform. The Company has credit risk on the gross spend through the Company&#146;s platform, which includes the
	amounts due to suppliers for purchases through the Company&#146;s platform plus the Company&#146;s platform fees, as the Company is required to pay suppliers irrespective of whether the Company collects from clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on these and other factors, the Company has determined
	it is not the principal in the purchase and sale of advertising inventory, data and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	add-on
</FONT>
	features in all of the Company&#146;s arrangements and therefore reports revenue on a net basis for the fees the
	Company charges clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s
	accounts receivable are recorded at the amount of gross billings to clients, net of allowances (&#147;Gross Billings&#148;), for the amounts it is responsible to collect, and accounts payable are recorded at the net amount payable to suppliers.
	Accordingly, both accounts receivable and accounts payable appear large in relation to revenue reported on a net basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-8
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company classifies its operating expenses into four
	categories:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Platform
	Operations.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Platform operations expense consists of expenses related to hosting the Company&#146;s platform and providing support to clients. Platform operations expense includes hosting costs, personnel costs,
	amortization of capitalized software costs for the development of the Company&#146;s platform and allocated overhead. Personnel costs included in platform operations include salaries, bonuses,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation, and employee benefit costs, and are primarily attributable to personnel who provide the Company&#146;s clients with support using the Company&#146;s platform and the Company&#146;s network operations group, who support the
	Company&#146;s platform. The Company capitalizes certain costs associated with the development of the Company&#146;s platform and amortizes these costs over their estimated useful lives in platform operations expense. The Company allocates overhead
	such as information technology infrastructure, rent and occupancy charges based on headcount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Sales and Marketing.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales and marketing expense consists primarily of personnel costs, including salaries, bonuses,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation, employee benefits costs and commission costs for the Company&#146;s sales and marketing personnel. Sales and marketing expense also includes costs for market development programs, advertising, promotional and other marketing
	activities, and allocated overhead. The Company allocates overhead such as information technology infrastructure, rent and occupancy charges based on headcount. Commissions costs are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Technology and
	Development.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s technology and development expenses consist primarily of personnel costs, including salaries, bonuses,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation and employee benefits
	costs, third party consultant costs associated with the ongoing development and maintenance of the Company&#146;s platform, amortization of capitalized third party software used in the development of the Company&#146;s platform and allocated
	overhead. The Company allocates overhead such as information technology infrastructure, rent and occupancy charges based on headcount. Technology and development costs are expensed as incurred, except to the extent that such costs are associated
	with software development that qualify for capitalization, which are then recorded as capitalized software development costs included in other assets,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-current
</FONT>
	on the Company&#146;s consolidated balance
	sheet. The Company amortizes capitalized software development costs relating to the Company&#146;s platform to platform operations expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	General and Administrative.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s general and administrative expenses consist primarily of
	personnel costs, including salaries, bonuses,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation, and employee benefits costs associated with the Company&#146;s executive, finance, legal, human resources, compliance, and other
	administrative personnel, as well as accounting and legal professional services fees, bad debt expense and allocated overhead. The Company allocates overhead such as information technology infrastructure, rent and occupancy charges based on
	headcount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Stock-Based
</FONT>
	Compensation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Compensation expense related to stock options, restricted stock awards and units, which are referred to
	collectively as restricted stock, and awards granted under the Company&#146;s employee stock purchase plan, or ESPP, is measured and recognized in the consolidated financial statements based on the fair value of the awards granted. The fair value of
	each option award is estimated on the grant date using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Black-Scholes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	option-pricing
</FONT>
	model. The fair value of restricted stock is calculated using the closing market
	price of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of grant.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation expense related to stock options and restricted stock is recognized on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	basis over the requisite service periods of the awards, which is generally four years. Stock-based
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-9
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage134"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	compensation expense for ESPP awards is recognized on a graded-vesting attribution basis over the requisite service period of each award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Stock options granted to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-employees
</FONT>
	are accounted for at fair value
	determined by using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Black-Scholes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	option-pricing
</FONT>
	model. The Company believes that the fair value of the stock options is more reliably measured than the fair value
	of the services received. The fair value of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-employee
</FONT>
	stock options is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-measured
</FONT>
	each period until a commitment date is reached, which is generally the vesting
	date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Determining the fair value of stock
	options and ESPP awards requires judgment. The Company&#146;s use of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Black-Scholes
</FONT>
	option pricing model requires the input of subjective assumptions, including the fair value of the underlying common stock
	for periods prior to the completion of the Company&#146;s IPO, the expected term of the option, the expected volatility of the Company&#146;s common stock,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	risk-free
</FONT>
	interest rates, and the expected dividend
	yield of the Company&#146;s common stock. The assumptions used in the Company&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	option-pricing
</FONT>
	model represent management&#146;s best estimates. These estimates involve inherent uncertainties and the
	application of management&#146;s judgment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These
	assumptions and estimates are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Fair Value of Common Stock.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For stock options granted subsequent to the Company&#146;s IPO and ESPP awards,
	the fair value of common stock is based on the closing price of its common stock as reported on the NASDAQ Global Market on the grant date. Prior to the IPO, the board of directors determined the fair value of the common stock at the time of the
	grant of options by considering a number of objective and subjective factors including the Company&#146;s actual operating and financial performance, market conditions and performance of comparable publicly traded companies, developments and
	milestones in the Company, the likelihood of achieving a liquidity event and transactions involving the Company&#146;s preferred or common stock, among other factors. The fair value was determined in accordance with applicable elements of the
	practice aid issued by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants,
<I>
	Valuation of Privately Held Company Equity Securities Issued as Compensation
</I>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Risk-Free
</FONT>
	Interest Rate.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	risk-free
</FONT>
	interest rate is based on the yields of U.S. Treasury securities with maturities approximating the term of the awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Expected Term.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Given
	insufficient historical data relating to stock option exercises, to determine the expected term, the Company applies the simplified approach, in which the expected term of an award is presumed to be the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mid-point
</FONT>
	between the vesting date and the expiration date of the award. For ESPP awards, the expected term is the time period from the grant date to the respective purchase dates included within each offering
	period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Volatility.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Because the Company has a short trading history for its common stock, the Company determines the
	price volatility based on the historical volatilities of a publicly traded peer group based on daily price observations over a period equivalent to the expected term of the award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Dividend Yield.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The dividend
	yield assumption is based on the Company&#146;s history and current expectations of dividend payouts. The Company has never declared or paid any cash dividends on its common stock and does not anticipate paying any cash dividends in the foreseeable
	future, so the Company used an expected dividend yield of zero.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company early adopted Accounting Standards Update, or ASU,&nbsp;No.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2016-09,
</FONT>
<I>
	Compensation&#151;Stock
	Compensation (Topic&nbsp;718): Improvements to Employee
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Share-Based
</FONT>
	Payment Accounting
</I>
	and changed its policy from estimating forfeitures to recording forfeitures when they occur. The impact of forfeitures
	on the Company&#146;s historical consolidated financial statements was not material.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-10
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage135"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company will continue to use judgment in evaluating the assumptions related to the
	Company&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	compensation. Future expense amounts for any particular period could be affected by changes in the Company&#146;s assumptions or market conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are determined
	based upon the net tax effects of the differences between the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements carrying amounts and the tax basis of assets and liabilities and are measured using the enacted tax rate expected to apply to taxable
	income in the years in which the differences are expected to be reversed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A valuation allowance is used to reduce some or all of the deferred tax assets if, based upon the weight of available evidence, it is more likely than not that those deferred tax assets will not be
	realized. During 2014, the Company released the valuation allowance of $2.2 million previously established against its U.S. net deferred tax assets. Management&#146;s conclusion to release such valuation allowance was due to, among other reasons,
	three years of cumulative
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	income adjusted for permanent items realized in U.S. jurisdictions, and significant projected U.S.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax
	position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The tax benefits recognized in the consolidated financial statements from
	such positions are then measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized. The Company recognizes interest and penalties accrued related to its uncertain tax positions in its income tax provision in the
	accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income (Loss) Per Share Attributable to Common Stockholders
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Basic net income (loss) per share attributable to common stockholders is calculated by dividing the net income
	(loss) attributable to common stockholders by the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	weighted-average
</FONT>
	number of shares of common stock outstanding. The Company applies the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-class
</FONT>
	method to allocate net
	income (loss) between common and other participating securities based on their participation rights. Prior to the conversion of preferred stock to common stock concurrent with the IPO and because the holders of the Company&#146;s convertible
	preferred stock were entitled to participate in dividends, the Company allocated net income to common and preferred stock based on their respective rights to receive dividends, whether or not declared. For 2015, the adjustment to the carrying value
	of the Series&nbsp;B preferred stock (Note 9) has been recorded as a benefit to net income (loss) attributable to common stockholders. For 2016, the excess of the repurchase price of preferred stock over its carrying value (Note 9) has been recorded
	as a reduction to net income to determine net loss attributable to common stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Diluted net income (loss) per share attributable to common stockholders adjusts the basic net income (loss) per share attributable to common stockholders and the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	weighted-average
</FONT>
	number of shares of common stock outstanding for the potentially dilutive impact of stock options, restricted stock, ESPP and warrants, using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	treasury-stock
</FONT>
	method, and convertible preferred stock using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	as-if-converted
</FONT>
</FONT>
	method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Cash
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, cash consisted of
	cash held in checking accounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-11
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage136"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Accounts Receivable and Allowance for Doubtful Accounts
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Accounts receivable are recorded at the invoiced amount, are
	unsecured and do not bear interest. The Company performs ongoing credit evaluations of its clients and certain advertisers when the Company&#146;s agreements with its clients contain sequential liability terms that provide that the client payments
	are not due to the Company until the client has received payment from its customers who are advertisers. The allowance for doubtful accounts is based on the best estimate of the amount of probable credit losses in existing accounts receivable. The
	allowance for doubtful accounts is determined based on historical collection experience and the review in each period of the status of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	then-outstanding
</FONT>
	accounts receivable, while taking into consideration
	current client information, subsequent collection history and other relevant data. The Company reviews the allowance for doubtful accounts on a quarterly basis. Account balances are charged off against the allowance when the Company believes it is
	probable the receivable will not be recovered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table presents changes in the allowance for doubtful accounts (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	at historical cost, less accumulated depreciation and amortization. Depreciation is computed using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	method based upon the following estimated useful lives:

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;MARGIN-LEFT:6%;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:23%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	*
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Leasehold improvements are amortized on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	basis over the term of the lease, or the useful life of the assets,
	whichever is shorter.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Repair and
	maintenance costs are charged to expense as incurred, while renewals and improvements are capitalized. When assets are retired or otherwise disposed of, the cost and related accumulated depreciation are removed from the accounts and any resulting
	gain or loss is reflected in the Company&#146;s operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Capitalized Software Development Costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company capitalizes certain costs associated with creating and enhancing internally developed software related to the Company&#146;s technology infrastructure. These costs include personnel and
	related employee benefits expenses for employees who are directly associated with and who devote time to software development projects, and external direct costs of materials and services consumed in developing or obtaining the software. Software
	development costs that do not qualify for capitalization, as further discussed below, are expensed as incurred and recorded in technology and development expenses in the consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-12
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Software development activities typically consist of three stages: (1)&nbsp;the planning
	phase; (2)&nbsp;the application and infrastructure development stage; and (3)&nbsp;the post implementation stage. Costs incurred in the planning and post implementation phases, including costs associated with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	post-configuration
</FONT>
	training and repairs and maintenance of the developed technologies, are expensed as incurred. The Company capitalizes costs associated with software developed when the preliminary project
	stage is completed, management implicitly or explicitly authorizes and commits to funding the project and it is probable that the project will be completed and perform as intended. Costs incurred in the application and infrastructure development
	phases, including significant enhancements and upgrades, are capitalized. Capitalization ends once a project is substantially complete and the software is ready for its intended purpose. Software development costs are amortized using a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	method over the estimated useful life of two years, commencing when the software is ready for its intended use. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	recognition method approximates
	the manner in which the expected benefit will be derived.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company does not transfer ownership of its internally developed software, or lease its software, to third parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Leases
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company records rent expense for operating leases, some
	of which have escalating rent payments, on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	basis over the lease term. The Company begins recognition of rent expense on the date of initial possession, which is generally when the Company
	enters the leased premises and begins to make improvements in preparation for its intended use. Some of the Company&#146;s lease arrangements provide for concessions by the landlords, including payments for leasehold improvements and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	rent-free
</FONT>
	periods. The Company accounts for the difference between the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	rent expense and rent paid as a deferred rent liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Debt Issuance Costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Debt issuance costs related to the term loans have been
	recorded as a reduction of the carrying amount of the debt and are amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method. Debt financing costs associated with credit facilities have been deferred and recorded in other assets and are
	amortized to interest expense on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	straight-line
</FONT>
	basis over the term of the credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Preferred Stock Warrant Liabilities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Prior to the completion of the Company&#146;s IPO, warrants
	to purchase preferred stock of the Company were accounted for as liabilities at fair value because the underlying shares of convertible preferred stock were contingently redeemable, including in the case of a deemed liquidation, which could have
	obligated the Company to transfer assets to the preferred stockholders. The preferred stock warrants were recorded at fair value at each balance sheet date and changes in the fair value of the preferred stock warrants during each reporting period
	were recorded in the Company&#146;s consolidated statements of operations until the earlier of the exercise or expiration of the warrants or the warrants&#146; conversion to warrants to purchase common stock, at which time any remaining liability
	was reclassified to additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-in
</FONT>
	capital. Immediately prior to the completion of the Company&#146;s IPO, all of the Company&#146;s then-outstanding convertible preferred stock warrants were remeasured to
	fair value and automatically converted and reclassified into Class B common stock warrants and all remaining warrants were net exercised.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Fair value is defined as the exchange price that would be
	received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price) in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an orderly transaction
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-13
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	between market participants on the measurement date. Valuation techniques used to measure fair value must maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs. Fair
	value measurements are based on a fair value hierarchy, based on three levels of inputs, of which the first two are considered observable and the last unobservable, which are the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Level&nbsp;1&#151;Quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or
	liabilities that the Company has the ability to access at the measurement date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Level&nbsp;2&#151;Inputs other than quoted prices included within Level&nbsp;1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly, such as quoted market prices for similar
	assets and liabilities; quoted prices in markets that are not active; or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the asset or liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Level&nbsp;3&#151;Unobservable inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Observable inputs are based on market data
	obtained from independent sources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The carrying
	amounts of accounts receivable, accounts payable, accrued expenses and other current liabilities approximate fair value due to the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	short-term
</FONT>
	nature of these instruments. The carrying value of the line of
	credit and term loans approximates fair value based on borrowing rates currently available to the Company for financing with similar terms and were determined to be Level&nbsp;2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s convertible preferred stock warrants were
	measured using unobservable inputs that required a high level of judgment to determine fair value, and were thus classified as Level&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Certain long lived assets including capitalized software development costs are also subject to measurement at fair value on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recurring
</FONT>
	basis if they are deemed to be impaired as a result of an impairment review. To date, no impairments have been recorded on those assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Concentration of Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company
	to concentration of credit risk consist principally of cash and accounts receivable. The Company maintains its cash with financial institutions and its cash levels exceed the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) federally insured limits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For 2014, one client accounted for 11% of Gross
	Billings. For 2015, two clients each accounted for 12% of Gross Billings. For 2016, three clients accounted for 15%, 13% and 11%, respectively, of Gross Billings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, three clients accounted for
	18%, 13% and 10%, respectively, of consolidated accounts receivable. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, three clients accounted for 27%, 13% and 12%, respectively, of consolidated accounts receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, one supplier accounted for 11%
	of consolidated accounts payable. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, one supplier accounted for 10% of consolidated accounts payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Foreign Currency Transactions and Translation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has entities operating in various countries.
	Each of these entities&#146; functional currency is the U.S. Dollar. Transactions in foreign currencies are translated into U.S. Dollars at the rates of exchange in effect at the date of the transaction. Net transaction losses were approximately
	$0.3 million, $1.0 million, and $1.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively, and are included in foreign currency exchange loss, net in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-14
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage139"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Commencing in 2015 the Company entered into forward contracts to hedge foreign currency
	exposures related primarily to the Company&#146;s foreign currency denominated accounts receivable. The Company does not designate the foreign exchange forward contracts as hedges for accounting purposes and changes in the fair value of the foreign
	exchange forward contracts are recorded in foreign exchange loss, net in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, the Company had open forward contracts with aggregate notional amounts of $5.9
	million and $27.1&nbsp;million, respectively. The fair value of the open forward contracts was not material. The Company&#146;s forward contracts generally have terms of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	30-210&nbsp;days.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act (&#147;JOBS
	Act&#148;), the Company meets the definition of an emerging growth company. The Company has irrevocably elected to opt out of the extended transition period for complying with new or revised accounting standards pursuant to Section&nbsp;107(b) of
	the JOBS Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In May 2014, the Financial
	Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued Accounting Standards Update, or ASU,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	No.&nbsp;2014-09,
</FONT>
<I>
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606)
</I>
	, which amends the existing accounting
	standards for revenue recognition. Under ASU
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2014-09,
</FONT>
	a company will recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which it expects
	to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. Additionally, the guidance requires improved disclosures to help users of financial statements better understand the nature, amount, timing, and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising
	from contracts with customers. In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	No.&nbsp;2015-14,
</FONT>
	which defers the effective date of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	ASU&nbsp;2014-09
</FONT>
	by one year. During 2016, the
	FASB has continued to issue additional amendments to the new revenue guidance. The new guidance is effective for annual reporting periods (including interim periods within those periods) beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017. Early adoption is
	permitted for annual reporting periods (including interim periods within those periods) beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016. The guidance permits the use of either the retrospective or cumulative effect transition method. The Company has not yet
	selected a transition method or determined the effect of this guidance on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	No.&nbsp;2016-02,
</FONT>
<I>
	Leases
</I>
	, which requires an entity to
	recognize
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	right-of-use
</FONT>
</FONT>
	assets and lease liabilities on its balance sheet and disclose key information about leasing arrangements. The guidance offers specific accounting
	guidance for a lessee, lessor, and sale and leaseback transactions. Lessees and lessors are required to disclose qualitative and quantitative information about leasing arrangements to enable a user of the financial statements to assess the amount,
	timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. Leases will be classified as either finance or operating, with the classification affecting the pattern of expense recognition in the income statement. The guidance is effective for annual
	reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018, including interim periods within that reporting period, and requires a modified retrospective adoption, with early adoption permitted. Although the Company is currently evaluating the impact
	of this guidance on its consolidated financial statements, the Company expects that most of its operating lease commitments will be recognized as operating lease liabilities and right-of-use assets upon adoption of the new guidance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	No.&nbsp;2016-09,
</FONT>
<I>
	Compensation&#151;Stock Compensation (Topic&nbsp;718)
</I>
	:
<I>
	Improvements to Employee
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Share-Based
</FONT>
	Payment Accounting
</I>
	, which includes multiple
	provisions intended to simplify various aspects of the accounting for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	share-based
</FONT>
	payments, including forfeitures, accounting for income taxes, classification of excess tax benefits on the statement of cash
	flows, statutory tax withholding requirements and other stock-based compensation classification matters. ASU 2016-09 is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, and interim periods within those annual periods.
	Early adoption is permitted in any interim or annual period with the impact of the adoption recorded as a
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-15
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage140"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D337825DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;2&#151;Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant
	Accounting Policies&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	cumulative-effect
</FONT>
	adjustment as of the beginning of the year in which the guidance is adopted. Changes in the classification of excess tax benefits on the
	statement of cash flows as a result of the adoption of this guidance may be recorded on a retrospective or prospective basis. The Company elected to early adopt this guidance during the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and changed its
	accounting policy to record forfeitures of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stock-based
</FONT>
	awards when they occur. The Company&#146;s adoption of this guidance did not have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements. The Company
	had no excess tax benefits as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and elected to record any future excess tax benefits in the statement of cash flows as an operating activity on a prospective basis. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	cumulative-effect
</FONT>
	adjustment as a result of the adoption of this guidance for the change in accounting policy for forfeitures was approximately $5,000 and was recorded in the statement of operations during the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, rather than an adjustment to the retained earnings (accumulated deficit) as the amount was not material. The change in accounting policy to record forfeitures when they occur and the requirement to record excess
	tax benefits when they occur in the statement of operations will result in increased volatility in earnings in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2016-13,
<I>
	Financial Instruments-Credit Losses (Topic 326): Measurement of Credit Losses on
	Financial Instruments
</I>
	, which is intended to provide more decision-useful information about expected credit losses on financial instruments and other commitments to extend credit held by a reporting entity at each reporting date. ASU 2016-13
	revises the impairment model to utilize an expected loss methodology in place of the currently used incurred loss methodology, which will result in more timely recognition of losses on financial instruments, including, but not limited to, available
	for sale debt securities and accounts receivable. The Company is required to adopt this standard starting in the first quarter of fiscal year 2021. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact of
	adoption on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In August 2016, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2016-15,
<I>
	Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230), Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and
	Cash Payments
</I>
	, which addresses eight specific cash flow issues with the objective of reducing the existing diversity in practice. ASU 2016-15 is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017, and interim periods within those
	fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted, including adoption in an interim period. If adopted in an interim period, any adjustments should be reflected as of the beginning of the fiscal year that includes such interim period. The adoption of ASU
	2016-15 should be applied using a retrospective transition method to each period presented, unless impracticable to do so. The Company does not expect the adoption of ASU 2016-15 will have a material impact on its consolidated statement of cash
	flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-16
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;3&#151;Net Income (Loss) Per Share Attributable to Common Stockholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has two classes of common stock, Class&nbsp;A
	and Class B. Basic and diluted net income (loss) per share attributable to common stockholders for Class&nbsp;A and Class B common stock were the same because they were entitled to the same liquidation and dividend rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	basic and diluted net income (loss) per share attributable to common stockholders are as follows (in thousands, except per share amounts):

</FONT>

</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation expense for
	2014, 2015 and 2016 was $0.3&nbsp;million, $1.0&nbsp;million and $2.4 million respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has purchased software under a financing arrangement where the Company makes installment payments over a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	four-year
</FONT>
	period. The Company has taken
	possession of the software and runs the software on its own equipment. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, the software had a cost basis of $1.8&nbsp;million. Accumulated depreciation on this software as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016 was
	$0.5 million and $0.9&nbsp;million, respectively. Depreciation expense on this software was $0.1 million for 2014, $0.4&nbsp;million for 2015 and $0.4&nbsp;million for 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To date, there have been no impairment charges to property
	and equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

	The Company capitalized $0.8
	million, $1.8&nbsp;million and $2.4&nbsp;million of software development costs in 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively. Amortization expense was $0.4 million, $0.9&nbsp;million and $1.4&nbsp;million for 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively. Based on the
	Company&#146;s capitalized software development costs ready for intended use as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, estimated amortization expense of $1.2&nbsp;million and $0.5&nbsp;million is expected to be recognized in 2017 and 2018, respectively.
	Amortization has not started on $1.1&nbsp;million of capitalized software development costs that are not yet ready for intended use as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

	The Company&#146;s preferred
	stock warrants are recorded at fair value and were determined to be Level&nbsp;3 fair value items. The changes in the fair value of preferred stock warrants are summarized below (in thousands):

	during September 2016, outstanding warrants exercisable for 1,382,505 shares of convertible preferred stock were automatically converted into warrants exercisable for 460,834 shares of

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	THE TRADE DESK, INC.
</B>
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="1">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;(Continued)

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Note&nbsp;6&#151;Fair Value Measurements&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Class&nbsp;B common stock and net exercised resulting in the issuance of 448,545 shares of Class B common stock based on the IPO price of $18.00 per share and taking into account the 1-for-3
	reverse stock split. The aggregate fair value of these warrants upon the closing of the IPO was $12.6 million, which was reclassified from liabilities to additional paid-in capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company determined the fair value of the preferred stock warrants utilizing the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Black-Scholes
</FONT>
	model with the following assumptions:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
